page.title: 10OIL SEED RAPE
page.content: Many of the fields near Archdeacon Neton in the late springtime were a vivid lemony yellow colour. The farmer called the plants which produced these colours rape, and explained that they were encouraged by the European Economic Community because when the flowers go to seed and drop off, the seeds which are left can be crushed to produce the oil which is used to make kooking oils and margarine. the plants Latin name is Brassica Napus which makes it one of the cabbage family and it is doubly useful to the farmers because the stems and leaves make good fodder for sheep and cattle in winter.
